titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the John Spangler Nicholas Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by William E. Brown, Jr. and John Espy

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 10:34

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, writings, photographs, and research files (1914-1963) documenting the professional career and personal life of John Spangler Nicholas, a biologist and zoologist. His academic work, editorial contributions to the Journal of Experimental Zoology , and scientific research are detailed. Correspondents include: Ross Granville Harrison, Charles Rupert Stockard, and the Wistar Institute of Anatomy and Biology.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 19, student grades, is restricted for 75 years from date of creation.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: John Spangler Nicholas Papers. Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of the estate of John S. Nicholas, 1964.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in six series: I. Correspondence, 1918-1963. II. Organizations, 1918-1963. III. Yale University, 1917-1963. IV. Writings, 1914-1962. V. Research Files, 1938-1963. VI. Personal Files, 1918-1939.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of correspondence, writings, photographs, and research files (1914-1963) documenting the professional career and personal life of John Spangler Nicholas, a biologist and zoologist. His academic work, editorial contributions to the Journal of Experimental Zoology , and scientific research are detailed. Correspondents include: Ross Granville Harrison, Charles Rupert Stockard, and the Wistar Institute of Anatomy and Biology.
The Nicholas Papers are arranged in thirty-three (33) boxes and one folio, and total thirteen linear feet. The papers are arranged in the following six series:

SERIES I. CORRESPONDENCE, 1918-1963, contains General and Select files of letters to and from Nicholas, primarily during his professional career as a biologist, zoologist, and editor of a scholarly journal. Correspondents include Ross Granville Harrison and Miroslava Pavlovic.

SERIES II. ORGANIZATIONS, 1918-1963, contains an alphabetical arrangement of files concerning organizations, societies, associations, and bodies which Nichoals joined, supported, or was involved with in the course of his academic and professional work. This series includes material relating to Nicholas' manpower study work on behalf of the Federation of American Societies for Experimental Biology (box 6, folders 52-56), the National Research Council (boxes 8-10, folders 63-77), the National Roster of Scientific and Specialized Personnel (box 10, folders 78-82), and the United States Departments of Labor and HEW (boxes 13-14, folders 108-11).

SERIES III. YALE UNIVERSITY, 1917-1963, contains material relating to Nicholas' academic and administrative work on behalf of the Department of Zoology, the Osborn Zoological Laboratory, and the Sheffield Scientific School. Student grades and teaching files are also included in this series.

SERIES IV. WRITINGS, 1914-1962, is arranged in two sections: John S. Nicholas and Others. Nicholas files include his student notes from several courses and drafts of articles and speeches. Others files contain drafts of works by colleagues, including Ross Granville Harrison.

SERIES V. RESEARCH FILES, contains material on specific grant-funded projects Nicholas pursued and/or conducted, samples of notes, drawings, and photographs relating to amphibian and rat research and publications, and laboratory materials.
SERIES VI. PERSONAL FILES, 1918-1939, contains photographs and memorabilia of Nicholas.
A folio in Series VI contains large research charts and memorabilia.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: John S. Nicholas was born on March 10, 1893 [or 1895] in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. He received his B.S. (1916) and M.S. (1917) from Pennsylvania College, and his Ph.D. from Yale University (1921). Nicholas held several academic positions at Yale University, including Bronson Professor of Comparative Anatomy (1935-1939), Sterling Professor of Biology (1939-1962), and Chairman of the Department of Zoology (1946-1956). He also served on the editorial board of the Journal of Experimental Zoology (1946-), as managing editor of the Journal (1947-), and as director of the Osborn Zoological Laboratory at Yale University (1947-). Nicholas was also a contributing member to many professional societies and organizations. He died in September, 1963 in New Haven, Connecticut.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright status for collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is divided into two sections: General and Select. General consists of two sub-sections: "Chronological" and "Alphabetical." Select is arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is arranged alphabetically by name of organization.

did.unittitle: American Academy of Arts and Sciences
Bermuda Biological Station for Research, Inc.
Federation of American Societies for Experimental Biology
Committee on Study of Manpower Needs in the Basic Health Sciences
National Roster of Scientific and Specialized Personnel
Code sheets, technical checklists, weekly reports
United States Departments of Labor and Health, Education, and Welfare: National Manpower Advisory Committee

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is divided into two sections: Administration and Teaching files. Administration is arranged alphabetically by name of office or department. Teaching files is arranged alphabetically by name or institution or course.

unittitle.title: Yale Journal of Biology and Medicine, Inc.

did.unittitle: Committee on the Course of Study for Yale College; Committee on Educational Planning

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Student grades are restricted for 75 years from date of creation due to University policy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is arranged in two sections: John S. Nicholas and Others. John S. Nicholas is arranged in two sub-sections: "Student notes" and "Articles and speeches." "Student notes" is arranged chronologically under institutional headings, and alphabetically by the name of the professor. "Articles and speeches" is arranged in two sub-sub-sections: chronological and alphabetical.
Others is arranged alphabetically by the author's name.

did.unittitle: Army Medical School, Vaccine Department; George Washington University

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is divided into three sections: Grant materials; Notes, Drawings, and Photographs; and Laboratory materials. Grant materials is arranged alphabetically by funding agency. Notes, drawings, and photographs is arranged under the headings: "Amphibians," "Rats," and "Miscellaneous." Laboratory materials occupies a single folder.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series is divided into two sections, Photographs and Memorabilia. Each is arranged chronologically.
